# Problem 1 

```{r}
iris_with_missing = 
  iris_with_missing %>%
  janitor::clean_names() 

fill_in = function(x) {
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    x = replace(x, is.na(x), "virginica")
  }
  
  else if (is.numeric(x)){
    omitted = na.omit(x)
    mean_x = mean(omitted)
    x = replace(x, is.na(x), mean_x)
  }
}


output = vector("list", length = 5)

for (i in 1:5) {
  output[[i]] = fill_in(iris_with_missing[[i]])
  
}

output = map_df(iris_with_missing, fill_in)

output = map_df(.x = iris_with_missing, ~ fill_in(.x))

sl = 
  iris_with_missing %>% 
  select(sepal_length) %>% 
  drop_na() 

mean(sl[["sepal_length"]])

```

# Problem 2

```{r}
a = as.list(list.files(path = "./data"))

read_data = function(file_name) {
  file_to_read = paste("./data/", file_name, sep="")
  data = read.csv(file = file_to_read)
  data %>% 
    mutate(subject = file_name) %>% 
    select(subject, everything()) %>% 
    mutate(
      subject = str_replace(subject, ".csv", "")
    )
}

output = vector("list", length = 20)

for (i in 1:20) {
  output[[i]] = read_data(a[[i]])
  
}

output = map_df(.x = a, ~ read_data(.x))

study_data = map_df(a, read_data)

study_data =
  pivot_longer(
    study_data, 
    week_1:week_8, 
    names_to = "week_number", 
    values_to = "data"
  ) %>% 
  mutate(id = subject) %>% 
  separate(subject, into = c("case", "subject"), sep="_") %>% 
  select(-subject)


study_data %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = week_number, y = data, color = case)) + 
    geom_line(aes(group = id)) + 
    labs(
    color = "Subject",
    title = "Control vs Experiment Weekly Data",
    x = "Week Number",
    y = "Experimental Data")

```

# Problem 3

```{r}
sim_regression = function(n = 30, beta0 = 2, beta1) {
  
  sim_data = tibble(
    x = rnorm(n, mean = 1, sd = 1),
    y = beta0 + beta1 * x + rnorm(n, 0, 50)
  )
  
  ls_fit = lm(y ~ x, data = sim_data) 
  
  tibble(
    beta1_hat = coef(ls_fit)[2],
    broom::tidy(ls_fit)$p.value
  )
}

n_list = list("n_0"  = 0, 
              "n_1"  = 1, 
              "n_2" = 2, 
              "n_3" = 3,
              "n_4" = 4,
              "n_5" = 5,
              "n_6" = 6)

output = vector("list", length = 4)

for (i in 1:7) {
  output[[i]] = rerun(10000, sim_regression(30, 2, n_list[[i]])) %>% 
    bind_rows
}

sim_results = 
  tibble(beta1_input = c(0,1,2,3,4,5,6)) %>%
  mutate(
    output_list = map(.x = beta1_input, ~rerun(1000, sim_regression(30, 2, .x))),
    output_df = map(output_list, bind_rows)) %>% 
  select(-output_list) %>% 
  unnest(output_df)
  

sim_results %>% 
  mutate(beta1_input = str_c("B1 = ", beta1_input),
         beta1_input = fct_inorder(beta1_input)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = beta1_input, y = `broom::tidy(ls_fit)$p.value`)) +
  geom_violin()

```
